segment.source: 4741(S) A computer account was created.
segment.target: 4741(S) A computer account was created.

segment.source: (Windows 10)
segment.target: (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes security event 4741(S) A computer account was created.
segment.target: Describes security event 4741(S) A computer account was created.

segment.source: 4741(S): A computer account was created.
segment.target: 4741(S): A computer account was created.

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016
segment.target: Windows Server 2016

segment.source: Event Description:
segment.target: Event Description:

segment.source: This event generates every time a new computer object is created.
segment.target: This event generates every time a new computer object is created.

segment.source: This event generates only on domain controllers.
segment.target: This event generates only on domain controllers.

segment.source: Note For recommendations, see Security Monitoring Recommendations for this event.
segment.target: Note For recommendations, see Security Monitoring Recommendations for this event.

segment.source: Event XML:
segment.target: Event XML:

segment.source: Required Server Roles: Active Directory domain controller.
segment.target: Required Server Roles: Active Directory domain controller.

segment.source: Minimum OS Version: Windows Server 2008.
segment.target: Minimum OS Version: Windows Server 2008.

segment.source: Event Versions: 0.
segment.target: Event Versions: 0.

segment.source: Field Descriptions:
segment.target: Field Descriptions:

segment.source: Subject:
segment.target: Subject:

segment.source: Security ID Type = SID: SID of account that requested the “create Computer object” operation.
segment.target: Security ID Type = SID: SID of account that requested the “create Computer object” operation.

segment.source: Event Viewer automatically tries to resolve SIDs and show the account name.
segment.target: Event Viewer automatically tries to resolve SIDs and show the account name.

segment.source: If the SID cannot be resolved, you will see the source data in the event.
segment.target: If the SID cannot be resolved, you will see the source data in the event.

segment.source: Note A security identifier (SID) is a unique value of variable length used to identify a trustee (security principal).
segment.target: Note A security identifier (SID) is a unique value of variable length used to identify a trustee (security principal).

segment.source: Each account has a unique SID that is issued by an authority, such as an Active Directory domain controller, and stored in a security database.
segment.target: Each account has a unique SID that is issued by an authority, such as an Active Directory domain controller, and stored in a security database.

segment.source: Each time a user logs on, the system retrieves the SID for that user from the database and places it in the access token for that user.
segment.target: Each time a user logs on, the system retrieves the SID for that user from the database and places it in the access token for that user.

segment.source: The system uses the SID in the access token to identify the user in all subsequent interactions with Windows security.
segment.target: The system uses the SID in the access token to identify the user in all subsequent interactions with Windows security.

segment.source: When a SID has been used as the unique identifier for a user or group, it cannot ever be used again to identify another user or group.
segment.target: When a SID has been used as the unique identifier for a user or group, it cannot ever be used again to identify another user or group.

segment.source: For more information about SIDs, see Security identifiers.
segment.target: For more information about SIDs, see Security identifiers.

segment.source: Account Name Type = UnicodeString: the name of the account that requested the “create Computer object” operation.
segment.target: Account Name Type = UnicodeString: the name of the account that requested the “create Computer object” operation.

segment.source: Account Domain Type = UnicodeString: subject’s domain name.
segment.target: Account Domain Type = UnicodeString: subject’s domain name.

segment.source: Formats vary, and include the following:
segment.target: Formats vary, and include the following:

segment.source: Domain NETBIOS name example: CONTOSO
segment.target: Domain NETBIOS name example: CONTOSO

segment.source: Lowercase full domain name: contoso.local
segment.target: Lowercase full domain name: contoso.local

segment.source: Uppercase full domain name: CONTOSO.LOCAL
segment.target: Uppercase full domain name: CONTOSO.LOCAL

segment.source: For some well-known security principals, such as LOCAL SERVICE or ANONYMOUS LOGON, the value of this field is “NT AUTHORITY”.
segment.target: For some well-known security principals, such as LOCAL SERVICE or ANONYMOUS LOGON, the value of this field is “NT AUTHORITY”.

segment.source: Logon ID Type = HexInt64: hexadecimal value that can help you correlate this event with recent events that might contain the same Logon ID, for example, “4624: An account was successfully logged on.”
segment.target: Logon ID Type = HexInt64: hexadecimal value that can help you correlate this event with recent events that might contain the same Logon ID, for example, “4624: An account was successfully logged on.”

segment.source: New Computer Account:
segment.target: New Computer Account:

segment.source: Security ID Type = SID: SID of created computer account.
segment.target: Security ID Type = SID: SID of created computer account.

segment.source: Event Viewer automatically tries to resolve SIDs and show the account name.
segment.target: Event Viewer automatically tries to resolve SIDs and show the account name.

segment.source: If the SID cannot be resolved, you will see the source data in the event.
segment.target: If the SID cannot be resolved, you will see the source data in the event.

segment.source: Account Name Type = UnicodeString: the name of the computer account that was created.
segment.target: Account Name Type = UnicodeString: the name of the computer account that was created.

segment.source: For example: WIN81$
segment.target: For example: WIN81$

segment.source: Account Domain Type = UnicodeString: domain name of created computer account.
segment.target: Account Domain Type = UnicodeString: domain name of created computer account.

segment.source: Formats vary, and include the following:
segment.target: Formats vary, and include the following:

segment.source: Domain NETBIOS name example: CONTOSO
segment.target: Domain NETBIOS name example: CONTOSO

segment.source: Lowercase full domain name: contoso.local
segment.target: Lowercase full domain name: contoso.local

segment.source: Uppercase full domain name: CONTOSO.LOCAL
segment.target: Uppercase full domain name: CONTOSO.LOCAL

segment.source: Attributes:
segment.target: Attributes:

segment.source: SAM Account Name Type = UnicodeString: logon name for account used to support clients and servers from previous versions of Windows (pre-Windows 2000 logon name).
segment.target: SAM Account Name Type = UnicodeString: logon name for account used to support clients and servers from previous versions of Windows (pre-Windows 2000 logon name).

segment.source: The value of sAMAccountName attribute of new computer object.
segment.target: The value of sAMAccountName attribute of new computer object.

segment.source: For example: WIN81$.
segment.target: For example: WIN81$.

segment.source: Display Name Type = UnicodeString: the value of displayName attribute of new computer object.
segment.target: Display Name Type = UnicodeString: the value of displayName attribute of new computer object.

segment.source: It is a name displayed in the address book for a particular account (typically – user account).
segment.target: It is a name displayed in the address book for a particular account (typically – user account).

segment.source: This is usually the combination of the user's first name, middle initial, and last name.
segment.target: This is usually the combination of the user's first name, middle initial, and last name.

segment.source: For computer objects, it is optional, and typically is not set.
segment.target: For computer objects, it is optional, and typically is not set.

segment.source: You can change this attribute by using Active Directory Users and Computers, or through a script, for example.
segment.target: You can change this attribute by using Active Directory Users and Computers, or through a script, for example.

segment.source: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.
segment.target: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.

segment.source: User Principal Name Type = UnicodeString: internet-style login name for the account, based on the Internet standard RFC 822.
segment.target: User Principal Name Type = UnicodeString: internet-style login name for the account, based on the Internet standard RFC 822.

segment.source: By convention this should map to the account's email name.
segment.target: By convention this should map to the account's email name.

segment.source: This parameter contains the value of userPrincipalName attribute of new computer object.
segment.target: This parameter contains the value of userPrincipalName attribute of new computer object.

segment.source: For computer objects, it is optional, and typically is not set.
segment.target: For computer objects, it is optional, and typically is not set.

segment.source: You can change this attribute by using Active Directory Users and Computers, or through a script, for example.
segment.target: You can change this attribute by using Active Directory Users and Computers, or through a script, for example.

segment.source: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.
segment.target: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.

segment.source: Home Directory Type = UnicodeString: user's home directory.
segment.target: Home Directory Type = UnicodeString: user's home directory.

segment.source: If homeDrive attribute is set and specifies a drive letter, homeDirectory should be a UNC path.
segment.target: If homeDrive attribute is set and specifies a drive letter, homeDirectory should be a UNC path.

segment.source: The path must be a network UNC of the form ServerShareDirectory.
segment.target: The path must be a network UNC of the form ServerShareDirectory.

segment.source: This parameter contains the value of homeDirectory attribute of new computer object.
segment.target: This parameter contains the value of homeDirectory attribute of new computer object.

segment.source: For computer objects, it is optional, and typically is not set.
segment.target: For computer objects, it is optional, and typically is not set.

segment.source: You can change this attribute by using Active Directory Users and Computers, or through a script, for example.
segment.target: You can change this attribute by using Active Directory Users and Computers, or through a script, for example.

segment.source: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.
segment.target: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.

segment.source: Home Drive Type = UnicodeString: specifies the drive letter to which to map the UNC path specified by homeDirectory account’s attribute.
segment.target: Home Drive Type = UnicodeString: specifies the drive letter to which to map the UNC path specified by homeDirectory account’s attribute.

segment.source: The drive letter must be specified in the form “DRIVELETTER:”.
segment.target: The drive letter must be specified in the form “DRIVELETTER:”.

segment.source: For example – “H:”.
segment.target: For example – “H:”.

segment.source: This parameter contains the value of homeDrive attribute of new computer object.
segment.target: This parameter contains the value of homeDrive attribute of new computer object.

segment.source: For computer objects, it is optional, and typically is not set.
segment.target: For computer objects, it is optional, and typically is not set.

segment.source: You can change this attribute by using Active Directory Users and Computers, or through a script, for example.
segment.target: You can change this attribute by using Active Directory Users and Computers, or through a script, for example.

segment.source: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.
segment.target: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.

segment.source: Script Path Type = UnicodeString: specifies the path of the account's logon script.
segment.target: Script Path Type = UnicodeString: specifies the path of the account's logon script.

segment.source: This parameter contains the value of scriptPath attribute of new computer object.
segment.target: This parameter contains the value of scriptPath attribute of new computer object.

segment.source: For computer objects, it is optional, and typically is not set.
segment.target: For computer objects, it is optional, and typically is not set.

segment.source: You can change this attribute by using Active Directory Users and Computers, or through a script, for example.
segment.target: You can change this attribute by using Active Directory Users and Computers, or through a script, for example.

segment.source: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.
segment.target: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.

segment.source: Profile Path Type = UnicodeString: specifies a path to the account's profile.
segment.target: Profile Path Type = UnicodeString: specifies a path to the account's profile.

segment.source: This value can be a null string, a local absolute path, or a UNC path.
segment.target: This value can be a null string, a local absolute path, or a UNC path.

segment.source: This parameter contains the value of profilePath attribute of new computer object.
segment.target: This parameter contains the value of profilePath attribute of new computer object.

segment.source: For computer objects, it is optional, and typically is not set.
segment.target: For computer objects, it is optional, and typically is not set.

segment.source: You can change this attribute by using Active Directory Users and Computers, or through a script, for example.
segment.target: You can change this attribute by using Active Directory Users and Computers, or through a script, for example.

segment.source: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.
segment.target: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.

segment.source: User Workstations Type = UnicodeString: contains the list of NetBIOS or DNS names of the computers from which the user can logon.
segment.target: User Workstations Type = UnicodeString: contains the list of NetBIOS or DNS names of the computers from which the user can logon.

segment.source: Each computer name is separated by a comma.
segment.target: Each computer name is separated by a comma.

segment.source: The name of a computer is the sAMAccountName property of a computer object.
segment.target: The name of a computer is the sAMAccountName property of a computer object.

segment.source: This parameter contains the value of userWorkstations attribute of new computer object.
segment.target: This parameter contains the value of userWorkstations attribute of new computer object.

segment.source: For computer objects, it is optional, and typically is not set.
segment.target: For computer objects, it is optional, and typically is not set.

segment.source: You can change this attribute by using Active Directory Users and Computers, or through a script, for example.
segment.target: You can change this attribute by using Active Directory Users and Computers, or through a script, for example.

segment.source: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.
segment.target: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.

segment.source: Password Last Set Type = UnicodeString: last time the account’s password was modified.
segment.target: Password Last Set Type = UnicodeString: last time the account’s password was modified.

segment.source: For manually created computer account, using Active Directory Users and Computers snap-in, this field typically has value “never”.
segment.target: For manually created computer account, using Active Directory Users and Computers snap-in, this field typically has value “never”.

segment.source: For computer account created during standard domain join procedure this field will contains time when computer object was created, because password creates during domain join procedure.
segment.target: For computer account created during standard domain join procedure this field will contains time when computer object was created, because password creates during domain join procedure.

segment.source: This parameter contains the value of pwdLastSet attribute of new computer object.
segment.target: This parameter contains the value of pwdLastSet attribute of new computer object.

segment.source: Account Expires Type = UnicodeString: the date when the account expires.
segment.target: Account Expires Type = UnicodeString: the date when the account expires.

segment.source: This parameter contains the value of accountExpires attribute of new computer object.
segment.target: This parameter contains the value of accountExpires attribute of new computer object.

segment.source: For computer objects, it is optional, and typically is not set.
segment.target: For computer objects, it is optional, and typically is not set.

segment.source: You can change this attribute by using Active Directory Users and Computers, or through a script, for example.
segment.target: You can change this attribute by using Active Directory Users and Computers, or through a script, for example.

segment.source: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.
segment.target: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.

segment.source: Primary Group ID Type = UnicodeString: Relative Identifier (RID) of computer’s object primary group.
segment.target: Primary Group ID Type = UnicodeString: Relative Identifier (RID) of computer’s object primary group.

segment.source:
Note
Relative identifier (RID) is a variable length number that is assigned to objects at creation and becomes part of the object's Security Identifier (SID) that uniquely identifies an account or group within a domain.
segment.target:
Note
Relative identifier (RID) is a variable length number that is assigned to objects at creation and becomes part of the object's Security Identifier (SID) that uniquely identifies an account or group within a domain.

segment.source: Typically, Primary Group field for new computer accounts has the following values:
segment.target: Typically, Primary Group field for new computer accounts has the following values:

segment.source: 516 (Domain Controllers) – for domain controllers.
segment.target: 516 (Domain Controllers) – for domain controllers.

segment.source: 521 (Read-only Domain Controllers) – for read-only domain controllers (RODC).
segment.target: 521 (Read-only Domain Controllers) – for read-only domain controllers (RODC).

segment.source: 515 (Domain Computers) – for member servers and workstations.
segment.target: 515 (Domain Computers) – for member servers and workstations.

segment.source: See this article https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/243330 for more information.
segment.target: See this article https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/243330 for more information.

segment.source: This parameter contains the value of primaryGroupID attribute of new computer object.
segment.target: This parameter contains the value of primaryGroupID attribute of new computer object.

segment.source: AllowedToDelegateTo Type = UnicodeString: the list of SPNs to which this account can present delegated credentials.
segment.target: AllowedToDelegateTo Type = UnicodeString: the list of SPNs to which this account can present delegated credentials.

segment.source: Can be changed using Active Directory Users and Computers management console in Delegation tab of computer account.
segment.target: Can be changed using Active Directory Users and Computers management console in Delegation tab of computer account.

segment.source: Typically it is set to “-“ for new computer objects.
segment.target: Typically it is set to “-“ for new computer objects.

segment.source: This parameter contains the value of AllowedToDelegateTo attribute of new computer object.
segment.target: This parameter contains the value of AllowedToDelegateTo attribute of new computer object.

segment.source: See description of AllowedToDelegateTo field for “4742: A computer account was changed” event for more details.
segment.target: See description of AllowedToDelegateTo field for “4742: A computer account was changed” event for more details.

segment.source:
Note
Service Principal Name (SPN) is the name by which a client uniquely identifies an instance of a service.
segment.target:
Note
Service Principal Name (SPN) is the name by which a client uniquely identifies an instance of a service.

segment.source: If you install multiple instances of a service on computers throughout a forest, each instance must have its own SPN.
segment.target: If you install multiple instances of a service on computers throughout a forest, each instance must have its own SPN.

segment.source: A given service instance can have multiple SPNs if there are multiple names that clients might use for authentication.
segment.target: A given service instance can have multiple SPNs if there are multiple names that clients might use for authentication.

segment.source: For example, an SPN always includes the name of the host computer on which the service instance is running, so a service instance might register an SPN for each name or alias of its host.
segment.target: For example, an SPN always includes the name of the host computer on which the service instance is running, so a service instance might register an SPN for each name or alias of its host.

segment.source: Old UAC Value Type = UnicodeString: specifies flags that control password, lockout, disable/enable, script, and other behavior for the user or computer account.
segment.target: Old UAC Value Type = UnicodeString: specifies flags that control password, lockout, disable/enable, script, and other behavior for the user or computer account.

segment.source: Old UAC value always “0x0” for new computer accounts.
segment.target: Old UAC value always “0x0” for new computer accounts.

segment.source: This parameter contains the previous value of userAccountControl attribute of computer object.
segment.target: This parameter contains the previous value of userAccountControl attribute of computer object.

segment.source: New UAC Value Type = UnicodeString: specifies flags that control password, lockout, disable/enable, script, and other behavior for the user or computer account.
segment.target: New UAC Value Type = UnicodeString: specifies flags that control password, lockout, disable/enable, script, and other behavior for the user or computer account.

segment.source: This parameter contains the value of userAccountControl attribute of new computer object.
segment.target: This parameter contains the value of userAccountControl attribute of new computer object.

segment.source: To decode this value, you can go through the property value definitions in the “Table 7.
segment.target: To decode this value, you can go through the property value definitions in the “Table 7.

segment.source: User’s or Computer’s account UAC flags.”
segment.target: User’s or Computer’s account UAC flags.”

segment.source: from largest to smallest.
segment.target: from largest to smallest.

segment.source: Compare each property value to the flags value in the event.
segment.target: Compare each property value to the flags value in the event.

segment.source: If the flags value in the event is greater than or equal to the property value, then the property is "set" and applies to that event.
segment.target: If the flags value in the event is greater than or equal to the property value, then the property is "set" and applies to that event.

segment.source: Subtract the property value from the flags value in the event and note that the flag applies and then go on to the next flag.
segment.target: Subtract the property value from the flags value in the event and note that the flag applies and then go on to the next flag.

segment.source: Here's an example: Flags value from event: 0x15
segment.target: Here's an example: Flags value from event: 0x15

segment.source: Decoding:
segment.target: Decoding:

segment.source: • PASSWDNOTREQD 0x0020
segment.target: • PASSWDNOTREQD 0x0020

segment.source: • LOCKOUT 0x0010
segment.target: • LOCKOUT 0x0010

segment.source: • HOMEDIRREQUIRED 0x0008
segment.target: • HOMEDIRREQUIRED 0x0008

segment.source: • (undeclared) 0x0004
segment.target: • (undeclared) 0x0004

segment.source: • ACCOUNTDISABLE 0x0002
segment.target: • ACCOUNTDISABLE 0x0002

segment.source: • SCRIPT 0x0001
segment.target: • SCRIPT 0x0001

segment.source: 0x0020 0x15, so PASSWDNOTREQD does not apply to this event
segment.target: 0x0020 0x15, so PASSWDNOTREQD does not apply to this event

segment.source: 0x10 0x15, so LOCKOUT applies to this event.
segment.target: 0x10 0x15, so LOCKOUT applies to this event.

segment.source: 0x4 0x5, so the undeclared value is set.
segment.target: 0x4 0x5, so the undeclared value is set.

segment.source: We'll pretend it doesn't mean anything.
segment.target: We'll pretend it doesn't mean anything.

segment.source: 0x2 0x1, so ACCOUNTDISABLE does not apply to this event
segment.target: 0x2 0x1, so ACCOUNTDISABLE does not apply to this event

segment.source: 0x1 = 0x1, so SCRIPT applies to this event.
segment.target: 0x1 = 0x1, so SCRIPT applies to this event.

segment.source: 0x1 - 0x1 = 0x0, we're done.
segment.target: 0x1 - 0x1 = 0x0, we're done.

segment.source: So this UAC flags value decodes to: LOCKOUT and SCRIPT
segment.target: So this UAC flags value decodes to: LOCKOUT and SCRIPT

segment.source: User Account Control Type = UnicodeString: shows the list of changes in userAccountControl attribute.
segment.target: User Account Control Type = UnicodeString: shows the list of changes in userAccountControl attribute.

segment.source: You will see a line of text for each change.
segment.target: You will see a line of text for each change.

segment.source: For new computer accounts, when the object for this account was created, the userAccountControl value was considered to be “0x0”, and then it was changed from “0x0” to the real value for the account's userAccountControl attribute.
segment.target: For new computer accounts, when the object for this account was created, the userAccountControl value was considered to be “0x0”, and then it was changed from “0x0” to the real value for the account's userAccountControl attribute.

segment.source: See possible values in the table below.
segment.target: See possible values in the table below.

segment.source: In the “User Account Control field text” column, you can see the text that will be displayed in the User Account Control field in 4741 event.
segment.target: In the “User Account Control field text” column, you can see the text that will be displayed in the User Account Control field in 4741 event.

segment.source: Flag Name
segment.target: Flag Name

segment.source: userAccountControl in hexadecimal
segment.target: userAccountControl in hexadecimal

segment.source: userAccountControl in decimal
segment.target: userAccountControl in decimal

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: User Account Control field text
segment.target: User Account Control field text

segment.source: SCRIPT
segment.target: SCRIPT

segment.source: The logon script will be run.
segment.target: The logon script will be run.

segment.source: Changes of this flag do not show in 4741 events.
segment.target: Changes of this flag do not show in 4741 events.

segment.source: ACCOUNTDISABLE
segment.target: ACCOUNTDISABLE

segment.source: The user account is disabled.
segment.target: The user account is disabled.

segment.source: Account Disabled
segment.target: Account Disabled

segment.source: Account Enabled
segment.target: Account Enabled

segment.source: Undeclared
segment.target: Undeclared

segment.source: This flag is undeclared.
segment.target: This flag is undeclared.

segment.source: Changes of this flag do not show in 4741 events.
segment.target: Changes of this flag do not show in 4741 events.

segment.source: HOMEDIRREQUIRED
segment.target: HOMEDIRREQUIRED

segment.source: The home folder is required.
segment.target: The home folder is required.

segment.source: 'Home Directory Required' - Enabled
segment.target: 'Home Directory Required' - Enabled

segment.source: 'Home Directory Required' - Disabled
segment.target: 'Home Directory Required' - Disabled

segment.source: LOCKOUT
segment.target: LOCKOUT

segment.source: Changes of this flag do not show in 4741 events.
segment.target: Changes of this flag do not show in 4741 events.

segment.source: PASSWDNOTREQD
segment.target: PASSWDNOTREQD

segment.source: No password is required.
segment.target: No password is required.

segment.source: 'Password Not Required' - Enabled
segment.target: 'Password Not Required' - Enabled

segment.source: 'Password Not Required' - Disabled
segment.target: 'Password Not Required' - Disabled

segment.source: PASSWDCANTCHANGE
segment.target: PASSWDCANTCHANGE

segment.source: The user cannot change the password.
segment.target: The user cannot change the password.

segment.source: This is a permission on the user's object.
segment.target: This is a permission on the user's object.

segment.source: Changes of this flag do not show in 4741 events.
segment.target: Changes of this flag do not show in 4741 events.

segment.source: ENCRYPTEDTEXTPWDALLOWED
segment.target: ENCRYPTEDTEXTPWDALLOWED

segment.source: The user can send an encrypted password.
segment.target: The user can send an encrypted password.

segment.source: Can be set using “Store password using reversible encryption” checkbox.
segment.target: Can be set using “Store password using reversible encryption” checkbox.

segment.source: 'Encrypted Text Password Allowed' - Disabled
segment.target: 'Encrypted Text Password Allowed' - Disabled

segment.source: 'Encrypted Text Password Allowed' - Enabled
segment.target: 'Encrypted Text Password Allowed' - Enabled

segment.source: TEMPDUPLICATEACCOUNT
segment.target: TEMPDUPLICATEACCOUNT

segment.source: This is an account for users whose primary account is in another domain.
segment.target: This is an account for users whose primary account is in another domain.

segment.source: This account provides user access to this domain, but not to any domain that trusts this domain.
segment.target: This account provides user access to this domain, but not to any domain that trusts this domain.

segment.source: This is sometimes referred to as a local user account.
segment.target: This is sometimes referred to as a local user account.

segment.source: Cannot be set for computer account.
segment.target: Cannot be set for computer account.

segment.source: NORMALACCOUNT
segment.target: NORMALACCOUNT

segment.source: This is a default account type that represents a typical user.
segment.target: This is a default account type that represents a typical user.

segment.source: 'Normal Account' - Disabled
segment.target: 'Normal Account' - Disabled

segment.source: 'Normal Account' - Enabled
segment.target: 'Normal Account' - Enabled

segment.source: INTERDOMAINTRUSTACCOUNT
segment.target: INTERDOMAINTRUSTACCOUNT

segment.source: This is a permit to trust an account for a system domain that trusts other domains.
segment.target: This is a permit to trust an account for a system domain that trusts other domains.

segment.source: Cannot be set for computer account.
segment.target: Cannot be set for computer account.

segment.source: WORKSTATIONTRUSTACCOUNT
segment.target: WORKSTATIONTRUSTACCOUNT

segment.source: This is a computer account for a computer that is running Microsoft Windows NT 4.0 Workstation, Microsoft Windows NT 4.0 Server, Microsoft Windows 2000 Professional, or Windows 2000 Server and is a member of this domain.
segment.target: This is a computer account for a computer that is running Microsoft Windows NT 4.0 Workstation, Microsoft Windows NT 4.0 Server, Microsoft Windows 2000 Professional, or Windows 2000 Server and is a member of this domain.

segment.source: 'Workstation Trust Account' - Disabled
segment.target: 'Workstation Trust Account' - Disabled

segment.source: 'Workstation Trust Account' - Enabled
segment.target: 'Workstation Trust Account' - Enabled

segment.source: SERVERTRUSTACCOUNT
segment.target: SERVERTRUSTACCOUNT

segment.source: This is a computer account for a domain controller that is a member of this domain.
segment.target: This is a computer account for a domain controller that is a member of this domain.

segment.source: 'Server Trust Account' - Enabled
segment.target: 'Server Trust Account' - Enabled

segment.source: 'Server Trust Account' - Disabled
segment.target: 'Server Trust Account' - Disabled

segment.source: DONTEXPIREPASSWORD
segment.target: DONTEXPIREPASSWORD

segment.source: Represents the password, which should never expire on the account.
segment.target: Represents the password, which should never expire on the account.

segment.source: Can be set using “Password never expires” checkbox.
segment.target: Can be set using “Password never expires” checkbox.

segment.source: 'Don't Expire Password' - Disabled
segment.target: 'Don't Expire Password' - Disabled

segment.source: 'Don't Expire Password' - Enabled
segment.target: 'Don't Expire Password' - Enabled

segment.source: MNSLOGONACCOUNT
segment.target: MNSLOGONACCOUNT

segment.source: This is an MNS logon account.
segment.target: This is an MNS logon account.

segment.source: 'MNS Logon Account' - Disabled
segment.target: 'MNS Logon Account' - Disabled

segment.source: 'MNS Logon Account' - Enabled
segment.target: 'MNS Logon Account' - Enabled

segment.source: SMARTCARDREQUIRED
segment.target: SMARTCARDREQUIRED

segment.source: When this flag is set, it forces the user to log on by using a smart card.
segment.target: When this flag is set, it forces the user to log on by using a smart card.

segment.source: 'Smartcard Required' - Disabled
segment.target: 'Smartcard Required' - Disabled

segment.source: 'Smartcard Required' - Enabled
segment.target: 'Smartcard Required' - Enabled

segment.source: TRUSTEDFORDELEGATION
segment.target: TRUSTEDFORDELEGATION

segment.source: When this flag is set, the service account (the user or computer account) under which a service runs is trusted for Kerberos delegation.
segment.target: When this flag is set, the service account (the user or computer account) under which a service runs is trusted for Kerberos delegation.

segment.source: Any such service can impersonate a client requesting the service.
segment.target: Any such service can impersonate a client requesting the service.

segment.source: To enable a service for Kerberos delegation, you must set this flag on the userAccountControl property of the service account.
segment.target: To enable a service for Kerberos delegation, you must set this flag on the userAccountControl property of the service account.

segment.source: If you enable Kerberos constraint or unconstraint delegation or disable these types of delegation in Delegation tab you will get this flag changed.
segment.target: If you enable Kerberos constraint or unconstraint delegation or disable these types of delegation in Delegation tab you will get this flag changed.

segment.source: 'Trusted For Delegation' - Enabled
segment.target: 'Trusted For Delegation' - Enabled

segment.source: 'Trusted For Delegation' - Disabled
segment.target: 'Trusted For Delegation' - Disabled

segment.source: NOTDELEGATED
segment.target: NOTDELEGATED

segment.source: When this flag is set, the security context of the user is not delegated to a service even if the service account is set as trusted for Kerberos delegation.
segment.target: When this flag is set, the security context of the user is not delegated to a service even if the service account is set as trusted for Kerberos delegation.

segment.source: Can be set using “Account is sensitive and cannot be delegated” checkbox.
segment.target: Can be set using “Account is sensitive and cannot be delegated” checkbox.

segment.source: 'Not Delegated' - Disabled
segment.target: 'Not Delegated' - Disabled

segment.source: 'Not Delegated' - Enabled
segment.target: 'Not Delegated' - Enabled

segment.source: USEDESKEYONLY
segment.target: USEDESKEYONLY

segment.source: Restrict this principal to use only Data Encryption Standard (DES) encryption types for keys.
segment.target: Restrict this principal to use only Data Encryption Standard (DES) encryption types for keys.

segment.source: Can be set using “Use Kerberos DES encryption types for this account” checkbox.
segment.target: Can be set using “Use Kerberos DES encryption types for this account” checkbox.

segment.source: 'Use DES Key Only' - Disabled
segment.target: 'Use DES Key Only' - Disabled

segment.source: 'Use DES Key Only' - Enabled
segment.target: 'Use DES Key Only' - Enabled

segment.source: DONTREQPREAUTH
segment.target: DONTREQPREAUTH

segment.source: This account does not require Kerberos pre-authentication for logging on.
segment.target: This account does not require Kerberos pre-authentication for logging on.

segment.source: Can be set using “Do not require Kerberos preauthentication” checkbox.
segment.target: Can be set using “Do not require Kerberos preauthentication” checkbox.

segment.source: 'Don't Require Preauth' - Disabled
segment.target: 'Don't Require Preauth' - Disabled

segment.source: 'Don't Require Preauth' - Enabled
segment.target: 'Don't Require Preauth' - Enabled

segment.source: PASSWORDEXPIRED
segment.target: PASSWORDEXPIRED

segment.source: The user's password has expired.
segment.target: The user's password has expired.

segment.source: Changes of this flag do not show in 4741 events.
segment.target: Changes of this flag do not show in 4741 events.

segment.source: TRUSTEDTOAUTHFORDELEGATION
segment.target: TRUSTEDTOAUTHFORDELEGATION

segment.source: The account is enabled for delegation.
segment.target: The account is enabled for delegation.

segment.source: This is a security-sensitive setting.
segment.target: This is a security-sensitive setting.

segment.source: Accounts that have this option enabled should be tightly controlled.
segment.target: Accounts that have this option enabled should be tightly controlled.

segment.source: This setting lets a service that runs under the account assume a client's identity and authenticate as that user to other remote servers on the network.
segment.target: This setting lets a service that runs under the account assume a client's identity and authenticate as that user to other remote servers on the network.

segment.source: If you enable Kerberos protocol transition delegation or disable this type of delegation in Delegation tab you will get this flag changed.
segment.target: If you enable Kerberos protocol transition delegation or disable this type of delegation in Delegation tab you will get this flag changed.

segment.source: 'Trusted To Authenticate For Delegation' - Disabled
segment.target: 'Trusted To Authenticate For Delegation' - Disabled

segment.source: 'Trusted To Authenticate For Delegation' - Enabled
segment.target: 'Trusted To Authenticate For Delegation' - Enabled

segment.source: PARTIALSECRETSACCOUNT
segment.target: PARTIALSECRETSACCOUNT

segment.source: The account is a read-only domain controller (RODC).
segment.target: The account is a read-only domain controller (RODC).

segment.source: This is a security-sensitive setting.
segment.target: This is a security-sensitive setting.

segment.source: Removing this setting from an RODC compromises security on that server.
segment.target: Removing this setting from an RODC compromises security on that server.

segment.source: No information.
segment.target: No information.

segment.source: Table 7.
segment.target: Table 7.

segment.source: User’s or Computer’s account UAC flags.
segment.target: User’s or Computer’s account UAC flags.

segment.source: User Parameters Type = UnicodeString: if you change any setting using Active Directory Users and Computers management console in Dial-in tab of computer’s account properties, then you will see value changed, but not displayed in this field in “4742(S): A computer account was changed.”
segment.target: User Parameters Type = UnicodeString: if you change any setting using Active Directory Users and Computers management console in Dial-in tab of computer’s account properties, then you will see value changed, but not displayed in this field in “4742(S): A computer account was changed.”

segment.source: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.
segment.target: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.

segment.source: SID History Type = UnicodeString: contains previous SIDs used for the object if the object was moved from another domain.
segment.target: SID History Type = UnicodeString: contains previous SIDs used for the object if the object was moved from another domain.

segment.source: Whenever an object is moved from one domain to another, a new SID is created and becomes the objectSID.
segment.target: Whenever an object is moved from one domain to another, a new SID is created and becomes the objectSID.

segment.source: The previous SID is added to the sIDHistory property.
segment.target: The previous SID is added to the sIDHistory property.

segment.source: This parameter contains the value of sIDHistory attribute of new computer object.
segment.target: This parameter contains the value of sIDHistory attribute of new computer object.

segment.source: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.
segment.target: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.

segment.source: Logon Hours Type = UnicodeString: hours that the account is allowed to logon to the domain.
segment.target: Logon Hours Type = UnicodeString: hours that the account is allowed to logon to the domain.

segment.source: The value of logonHours attribute of new computer object.
segment.target: The value of logonHours attribute of new computer object.

segment.source: For computer objects, it is optional, and typically is not set.
segment.target: For computer objects, it is optional, and typically is not set.

segment.source: You can change this attribute by using Active Directory Users and Computers, or through a script, for example.
segment.target: You can change this attribute by using Active Directory Users and Computers, or through a script, for example.

segment.source: You will see value not set value for new created computer accounts in event 4741.
segment.target: You will see value not set value for new created computer accounts in event 4741.

segment.source: DNS Host Name Type = UnicodeString: name of computer account as registered in DNS.
segment.target: DNS Host Name Type = UnicodeString: name of computer account as registered in DNS.

segment.source: The value of dNSHostName attribute of new computer object.
segment.target: The value of dNSHostName attribute of new computer object.

segment.source: For manually created computer account objects this field has value ““.
segment.target: For manually created computer account objects this field has value ““.

segment.source: Service Principal Names Type = UnicodeString: The list of SPNs, registered for computer account.
segment.target: Service Principal Names Type = UnicodeString: The list of SPNs, registered for computer account.

segment.source: For new computer accounts it will typically contain HOST SPNs and RestrictedKrbHost SPNs.
segment.target: For new computer accounts it will typically contain HOST SPNs and RestrictedKrbHost SPNs.

segment.source: The value of servicePrincipalName attribute of new computer object.
segment.target: The value of servicePrincipalName attribute of new computer object.

segment.source: For manually created computer objects it is typically equals ““.
segment.target: For manually created computer objects it is typically equals ““.

segment.source: This is an example of Service Principal Names field for new domain joined workstation:
segment.target: This is an example of Service Principal Names field for new domain joined workstation:

segment.source: HOST/Win81.contoso.local
segment.target: HOST/Win81.contoso.local

segment.source: RestrictedKrbHost/Win81.contoso.local
segment.target: RestrictedKrbHost/Win81.contoso.local

segment.source: HOST/WIN81
segment.target: HOST/WIN81

segment.source: RestrictedKrbHost/WIN81
segment.target: RestrictedKrbHost/WIN81

segment.source: Additional Information:
segment.target: Additional Information:

segment.source: Privileges Type = UnicodeString: the list of user privileges which were used during the operation, for example, SeBackupPrivilege.
segment.target: Privileges Type = UnicodeString: the list of user privileges which were used during the operation, for example, SeBackupPrivilege.

segment.source: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.
segment.target: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as “-”.

segment.source: See full list of user privileges in the table below:
segment.target: See full list of user privileges in the table below:

segment.source: Privilege Name
segment.target: Privilege Name

segment.source: User Right Group Policy Name
segment.target: User Right Group Policy Name

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: SeAssignPrimaryTokenPrivilege
segment.target: SeAssignPrimaryTokenPrivilege

segment.source: Replace a process-level token
segment.target: Replace a process-level token

segment.source: Required to assign the primary token of a process.
segment.target: Required to assign the primary token of a process.

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can initiate a process to replace the default token associated with a started subprocess.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can initiate a process to replace the default token associated with a started subprocess.

segment.source: SeAuditPrivilege
segment.target: SeAuditPrivilege

segment.source: Generate security audits
segment.target: Generate security audits

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can add entries to the security log.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can add entries to the security log.

segment.source: SeBackupPrivilege
segment.target: SeBackupPrivilege

segment.source: Back up files and directories
segment.target: Back up files and directories

segment.source: - Required to perform backup operations.
segment.target: - Required to perform backup operations.

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can bypass file and directory, registry, and other persistent object permissions for the purposes of backing up the system.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can bypass file and directory, registry, and other persistent object permissions for the purposes of backing up the system.

segment.source: This privilege causes the system to grant all read access control to any file, regardless of the access control list (ACL) specified for the file.
segment.target: This privilege causes the system to grant all read access control to any file, regardless of the access control list (ACL) specified for the file.

segment.source: Any access request other than read is still evaluated with the ACL.
segment.target: Any access request other than read is still evaluated with the ACL.

segment.source: The following access rights are granted if this privilege is held:
segment.target: The following access rights are granted if this privilege is held:

segment.source: READCONTROL
segment.target: READCONTROL

segment.source: ACCESSSYSTEMSECURITY
segment.target: ACCESSSYSTEMSECURITY

segment.source: FILEGENERICREAD
segment.target: FILEGENERICREAD

segment.source: FILETRAVERSE
segment.target: FILETRAVERSE

segment.source: SeChangeNotifyPrivilege
segment.target: SeChangeNotifyPrivilege

segment.source: Bypass traverse checking
segment.target: Bypass traverse checking

segment.source: Required to receive notifications of changes to files or directories.
segment.target: Required to receive notifications of changes to files or directories.

segment.source: This privilege also causes the system to skip all traversal access checks.
segment.target: This privilege also causes the system to skip all traversal access checks.

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can traverse directory trees even though the user may not have permissions on the traversed directory.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can traverse directory trees even though the user may not have permissions on the traversed directory.

segment.source: This privilege does not allow the user to list the contents of a directory, only to traverse directories.
segment.target: This privilege does not allow the user to list the contents of a directory, only to traverse directories.

segment.source: SeCreateGlobalPrivilege
segment.target: SeCreateGlobalPrivilege

segment.source: Create global objects
segment.target: Create global objects

segment.source: Required to create named file mapping objects in the global namespace during Terminal Services sessions.
segment.target: Required to create named file mapping objects in the global namespace during Terminal Services sessions.

segment.source: SeCreatePagefilePrivilege
segment.target: SeCreatePagefilePrivilege

segment.source: Create a pagefile
segment.target: Create a pagefile

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can create and change the size of a pagefile.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can create and change the size of a pagefile.

segment.source: SeCreatePermanentPrivilege
segment.target: SeCreatePermanentPrivilege

segment.source: Create permanent shared objects
segment.target: Create permanent shared objects

segment.source: Required to create a permanent object.
segment.target: Required to create a permanent object.

segment.source: This privilege is useful to kernel-mode components that extend the object namespace.
segment.target: This privilege is useful to kernel-mode components that extend the object namespace.

segment.source: Components that are running in kernel mode already have this privilege inherently; it is not necessary to assign them the privilege.
segment.target: Components that are running in kernel mode already have this privilege inherently; it is not necessary to assign them the privilege.

segment.source: SeCreateSymbolicLinkPrivilege
segment.target: SeCreateSymbolicLinkPrivilege

segment.source: Create symbolic links
segment.target: Create symbolic links

segment.source: Required to create a symbolic link.
segment.target: Required to create a symbolic link.

segment.source: SeCreateTokenPrivilege
segment.target: SeCreateTokenPrivilege

segment.source: Create a token object
segment.target: Create a token object

segment.source: Allows a process to create a token which it can then use to get access to any local resources when the process uses NtCreateToken() or other token-creation APIs.
segment.target: Allows a process to create a token which it can then use to get access to any local resources when the process uses NtCreateToken() or other token-creation APIs.

segment.source: When a process requires this privilege, we recommend using the LocalSystem account (which already includes the privilege), rather than creating a separate user account and assigning this privilege to it.
segment.target: When a process requires this privilege, we recommend using the LocalSystem account (which already includes the privilege), rather than creating a separate user account and assigning this privilege to it.

segment.source: SeDebugPrivilege
segment.target: SeDebugPrivilege

segment.source: Debug programs
segment.target: Debug programs

segment.source: Required to debug and adjust the memory of a process owned by another account.
segment.target: Required to debug and adjust the memory of a process owned by another account.

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can attach a debugger to any process or to the kernel.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can attach a debugger to any process or to the kernel.

segment.source: Developers who are debugging their own applications do not need this user right.
segment.target: Developers who are debugging their own applications do not need this user right.

segment.source: Developers who are debugging new system components need this user right.
segment.target: Developers who are debugging new system components need this user right.

segment.source: This user right provides complete access to sensitive and critical operating system components.
segment.target: This user right provides complete access to sensitive and critical operating system components.

segment.source: SeEnableDelegationPrivilege
segment.target: SeEnableDelegationPrivilege

segment.source: Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation
segment.target: Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation

segment.source: Required to mark user and computer accounts as trusted for delegation.
segment.target: Required to mark user and computer accounts as trusted for delegation.

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can set the Trusted for Delegation setting on a user or computer object.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can set the Trusted for Delegation setting on a user or computer object.

segment.source: The user or object that is granted this privilege must have write access to the account control flags on the user or computer object.
segment.target: The user or object that is granted this privilege must have write access to the account control flags on the user or computer object.

segment.source: A server process running on a computer (or under a user context) that is trusted for delegation can access resources on another computer using the delegated credentials of a client, as long as the account of the client does not have the Account cannot be delegated account control flag set.
segment.target: A server process running on a computer (or under a user context) that is trusted for delegation can access resources on another computer using the delegated credentials of a client, as long as the account of the client does not have the Account cannot be delegated account control flag set.

segment.source: SeImpersonatePrivilege
segment.target: SeImpersonatePrivilege

segment.source: Impersonate a client after authentication
segment.target: Impersonate a client after authentication

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can impersonate other accounts.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can impersonate other accounts.

segment.source: SeIncreaseBasePriorityPrivilege
segment.target: SeIncreaseBasePriorityPrivilege

segment.source: Increase scheduling priority
segment.target: Increase scheduling priority

segment.source: Required to increase the base priority of a process.
segment.target: Required to increase the base priority of a process.

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can use a process with Write property access to another process to increase the execution priority assigned to the other process.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can use a process with Write property access to another process to increase the execution priority assigned to the other process.

segment.source: A user with this privilege can change the scheduling priority of a process through the Task Manager user interface.
segment.target: A user with this privilege can change the scheduling priority of a process through the Task Manager user interface.

segment.source: SeIncreaseQuotaPrivilege
segment.target: SeIncreaseQuotaPrivilege

segment.source: Adjust memory quotas for a process
segment.target: Adjust memory quotas for a process

segment.source: Required to increase the quota assigned to a process.
segment.target: Required to increase the quota assigned to a process.

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can change the maximum memory that can be consumed by a process.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can change the maximum memory that can be consumed by a process.

segment.source: SeIncreaseWorkingSetPrivilege
segment.target: SeIncreaseWorkingSetPrivilege

segment.source: Increase a process working set
segment.target: Increase a process working set

segment.source: Required to allocate more memory for applications that run in the context of users.
segment.target: Required to allocate more memory for applications that run in the context of users.

segment.source: SeLoadDriverPrivilege
segment.target: SeLoadDriverPrivilege

segment.source: Load and unload device drivers
segment.target: Load and unload device drivers

segment.source: Required to load or unload a device driver.
segment.target: Required to load or unload a device driver.

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can dynamically load and unload device drivers or other code in to kernel mode.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can dynamically load and unload device drivers or other code in to kernel mode.

segment.source: This user right does not apply to Plug and Play device drivers.
segment.target: This user right does not apply to Plug and Play device drivers.

segment.source: SeLockMemoryPrivilege
segment.target: SeLockMemoryPrivilege

segment.source: Lock pages in memory
segment.target: Lock pages in memory

segment.source: Required to lock physical pages in memory.
segment.target: Required to lock physical pages in memory.

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can use a process to keep data in physical memory, which prevents the system from paging the data to virtual memory on disk.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can use a process to keep data in physical memory, which prevents the system from paging the data to virtual memory on disk.

segment.source: Exercising this privilege could significantly affect system performance by decreasing the amount of available random access memory (RAM).
segment.target: Exercising this privilege could significantly affect system performance by decreasing the amount of available random access memory (RAM).

segment.source: SeMachineAccountPrivilege
segment.target: SeMachineAccountPrivilege

segment.source: Add workstations to domain
segment.target: Add workstations to domain

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can create a computer account.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can create a computer account.

segment.source: This privilege is valid only on domain controllers.
segment.target: This privilege is valid only on domain controllers.

segment.source: SeManageVolumePrivilege
segment.target: SeManageVolumePrivilege

segment.source: Perform volume maintenance tasks
segment.target: Perform volume maintenance tasks

segment.source: Required to run maintenance tasks on a volume, such as remote defragmentation.
segment.target: Required to run maintenance tasks on a volume, such as remote defragmentation.

segment.source: SeProfileSingleProcessPrivilege
segment.target: SeProfileSingleProcessPrivilege

segment.source: Profile single process
segment.target: Profile single process

segment.source: Required to gather profiling information for a single process.
segment.target: Required to gather profiling information for a single process.

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can use performance monitoring tools to monitor the performance of non-system processes.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can use performance monitoring tools to monitor the performance of non-system processes.

segment.source: SeRelabelPrivilege
segment.target: SeRelabelPrivilege

segment.source: Modify an object label
segment.target: Modify an object label

segment.source: Required to modify the mandatory integrity level of an object.
segment.target: Required to modify the mandatory integrity level of an object.

segment.source: SeRemoteShutdownPrivilege
segment.target: SeRemoteShutdownPrivilege

segment.source: Force shutdown from a remote system
segment.target: Force shutdown from a remote system

segment.source: Required to shut down a system using a network request.
segment.target: Required to shut down a system using a network request.

segment.source: SeRestorePrivilege
segment.target: SeRestorePrivilege

segment.source: Restore files and directories
segment.target: Restore files and directories

segment.source: Required to perform restore operations.
segment.target: Required to perform restore operations.

segment.source: This privilege causes the system to grant all write access control to any file, regardless of the ACL specified for the file.
segment.target: This privilege causes the system to grant all write access control to any file, regardless of the ACL specified for the file.

segment.source: Any access request other than write is still evaluated with the ACL.
segment.target: Any access request other than write is still evaluated with the ACL.

segment.source: Additionally, this privilege enables you to set any valid user or group SID as the owner of a file.
segment.target: Additionally, this privilege enables you to set any valid user or group SID as the owner of a file.

segment.source: The following access rights are granted if this privilege is held:
segment.target: The following access rights are granted if this privilege is held:

segment.source: WRITEDAC
segment.target: WRITEDAC

segment.source: WRITEOWNER
segment.target: WRITEOWNER

segment.source: ACCESSSYSTEMSECURITY
segment.target: ACCESSSYSTEMSECURITY

segment.source: FILEGENERICWRITE
segment.target: FILEGENERICWRITE

segment.source: FILEADDFILE
segment.target: FILEADDFILE

segment.source: FILEADDSUBDIRECTORY
segment.target: FILEADDSUBDIRECTORY

segment.source: DELETE
segment.target: DELETE

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can bypass file, directory, registry, and other persistent objects permissions when restoring backed up files and directories and determines which users can set any valid security principal as the owner of an object.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can bypass file, directory, registry, and other persistent objects permissions when restoring backed up files and directories and determines which users can set any valid security principal as the owner of an object.

segment.source: SeSecurityPrivilege
segment.target: SeSecurityPrivilege

segment.source: Manage auditing and security log
segment.target: Manage auditing and security log

segment.source: Required to perform a number of security-related functions, such as controlling and viewing audit events in security event log.
segment.target: Required to perform a number of security-related functions, such as controlling and viewing audit events in security event log.

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can specify object access auditing options for individual resources, such as files, Active Directory objects, and registry keys.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can specify object access auditing options for individual resources, such as files, Active Directory objects, and registry keys.

segment.source: A user with this privilege can also view and clear the security log.
segment.target: A user with this privilege can also view and clear the security log.

segment.source: SeShutdownPrivilege
segment.target: SeShutdownPrivilege

segment.source: Shut down the system
segment.target: Shut down the system

segment.source: Required to shut down a local system.
segment.target: Required to shut down a local system.

segment.source: SeSyncAgentPrivilege
segment.target: SeSyncAgentPrivilege

segment.source: Synchronize directory service data
segment.target: Synchronize directory service data

segment.source: This privilege enables the holder to read all objects and properties in the directory, regardless of the protection on the objects and properties.
segment.target: This privilege enables the holder to read all objects and properties in the directory, regardless of the protection on the objects and properties.

segment.source: By default, it is assigned to the Administrator and LocalSystem accounts on domain controllers.
segment.target: By default, it is assigned to the Administrator and LocalSystem accounts on domain controllers.

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can synchronize all directory service data.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can synchronize all directory service data.

segment.source: This is also known as Active Directory synchronization.
segment.target: This is also known as Active Directory synchronization.

segment.source: SeSystemEnvironmentPrivilege
segment.target: SeSystemEnvironmentPrivilege

segment.source: Modify firmware environment values
segment.target: Modify firmware environment values

segment.source: Required to modify the nonvolatile RAM of systems that use this type of memory to store configuration information.
segment.target: Required to modify the nonvolatile RAM of systems that use this type of memory to store configuration information.

segment.source: SeSystemProfilePrivilege
segment.target: SeSystemProfilePrivilege

segment.source: Profile system performance
segment.target: Profile system performance

segment.source: Required to gather profiling information for the entire system.
segment.target: Required to gather profiling information for the entire system.

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can use performance monitoring tools to monitor the performance of system processes.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can use performance monitoring tools to monitor the performance of system processes.

segment.source: SeSystemtimePrivilege
segment.target: SeSystemtimePrivilege

segment.source: Change the system time
segment.target: Change the system time

segment.source: Required to modify the system time.
segment.target: Required to modify the system time.

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can change the time and date on the internal clock of the computer.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can change the time and date on the internal clock of the computer.

segment.source: Users that are assigned this user right can affect the appearance of event logs.
segment.target: Users that are assigned this user right can affect the appearance of event logs.

segment.source: If the system time is changed, events that are logged will reflect this new time, not the actual time that the events occurred.
segment.target: If the system time is changed, events that are logged will reflect this new time, not the actual time that the events occurred.

segment.source: SeTakeOwnershipPrivilege
segment.target: SeTakeOwnershipPrivilege

segment.source: Take ownership of files or other objects
segment.target: Take ownership of files or other objects

segment.source: Required to take ownership of an object without being granted discretionary access.
segment.target: Required to take ownership of an object without being granted discretionary access.

segment.source: This privilege allows the owner value to be set only to those values that the holder may legitimately assign as the owner of an object.
segment.target: This privilege allows the owner value to be set only to those values that the holder may legitimately assign as the owner of an object.

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can take ownership of any securable object in the system, including Active Directory objects, files and folders, printers, registry keys, processes, and threads.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can take ownership of any securable object in the system, including Active Directory objects, files and folders, printers, registry keys, processes, and threads.

segment.source: SeTcbPrivilege
segment.target: SeTcbPrivilege

segment.source: Act as part of the operating system
segment.target: Act as part of the operating system

segment.source: This privilege identifies its holder as part of the trusted computer base.
segment.target: This privilege identifies its holder as part of the trusted computer base.

segment.source: This user right allows a process to impersonate any user without authentication.
segment.target: This user right allows a process to impersonate any user without authentication.

segment.source: The process can therefore gain access to the same local resources as that user.
segment.target: The process can therefore gain access to the same local resources as that user.

segment.source: SeTimeZonePrivilege
segment.target: SeTimeZonePrivilege

segment.source: Change the time zone
segment.target: Change the time zone

segment.source: Required to adjust the time zone associated with the computer's internal clock.
segment.target: Required to adjust the time zone associated with the computer's internal clock.

segment.source: SeTrustedCredManAccessPrivilege
segment.target: SeTrustedCredManAccessPrivilege

segment.source: Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller
segment.target: Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller

segment.source: Required to access Credential Manager as a trusted caller.
segment.target: Required to access Credential Manager as a trusted caller.

segment.source: SeUndockPrivilege
segment.target: SeUndockPrivilege

segment.source: Remove computer from docking station
segment.target: Remove computer from docking station

segment.source: Required to undock a laptop.
segment.target: Required to undock a laptop.

segment.source: With this privilege, the user can undock a portable computer from its docking station without logging on.
segment.target: With this privilege, the user can undock a portable computer from its docking station without logging on.

segment.source: SeUnsolicitedInputPrivilege
segment.target: SeUnsolicitedInputPrivilege

segment.source: Not applicable
segment.target: Not applicable

segment.source: Required to read unsolicited input from a terminal device.
segment.target: Required to read unsolicited input from a terminal device.

segment.source: Table 8.
segment.target: Table 8.

segment.source: User Privileges.
segment.target: User Privileges.

segment.source: Security Monitoring Recommendations
segment.target: Security Monitoring Recommendations

segment.source: For 4741(S): A computer account was created.
segment.target: For 4741(S): A computer account was created.

segment.source: Important For this event, also see Appendix A: Security monitoring recommendations for many audit events.
segment.target: Important For this event, also see Appendix A: Security monitoring recommendations for many audit events.

segment.source: If your information security monitoring policy requires you to monitor computer account creation, monitor this event.
segment.target: If your information security monitoring policy requires you to monitor computer account creation, monitor this event.

segment.source: Consider whether to track the following fields and values:
segment.target: Consider whether to track the following fields and values:

segment.source: Field and value to track
segment.target: Field and value to track

segment.source: Reason to track
segment.target: Reason to track

segment.source: SAM Account Name: empty or -
segment.target: SAM Account Name: empty or -

segment.source: This field must contain the computer account name.
segment.target: This field must contain the computer account name.

segment.source: If it is empty or , it might indicate an anomaly.
segment.target: If it is empty or , it might indicate an anomaly.

segment.source: Display Name is not -
segment.target: Display Name is not -

segment.source: User Principal Name is not -
segment.target: User Principal Name is not -

segment.source: Home Directory is not -
segment.target: Home Directory is not -

segment.source: Home Drive is not -
segment.target: Home Drive is not -

segment.source: Script Path is not -
segment.target: Script Path is not -

segment.source: Profile Path is not -
segment.target: Profile Path is not -

segment.source: User Workstations is not -
segment.target: User Workstations is not -

segment.source: AllowedToDelegateTo is not -
segment.target: AllowedToDelegateTo is not -

segment.source: Typically these fields are for new computer accounts.
segment.target: Typically these fields are for new computer accounts.

segment.source: Other values might indicate an anomaly and should be monitored.
segment.target: Other values might indicate an anomaly and should be monitored.

segment.source: Password Last Set is never
segment.target: Password Last Set is never

segment.source: This typically means this is a manually created computer account, which you might need to monitor.
segment.target: This typically means this is a manually created computer account, which you might need to monitor.

segment.source: Account Expires is not never
segment.target: Account Expires is not never

segment.source: Typically this field is never for new computer accounts.
segment.target: Typically this field is never for new computer accounts.

segment.source: Other values might indicate an anomaly and should be monitored.
segment.target: Other values might indicate an anomaly and should be monitored.

segment.source: Primary Group ID is any value other than 515.
segment.target: Primary Group ID is any value other than 515.

segment.source: Typically, the Primary Group ID value is one of the following:
segment.target: Typically, the Primary Group ID value is one of the following:

segment.source: 516 for domain controllers
segment.target: 516 for domain controllers

segment.source: 521 for read only domain controllers (RODCs)
segment.target: 521 for read only domain controllers (RODCs)

segment.source: 515 for servers and workstations (domain computers)
segment.target: 515 for servers and workstations (domain computers)

segment.source: If the Primary Group ID is 516 or 521, it is a new domain controller or RODC, and the event should be monitored.
segment.target: If the Primary Group ID is 516 or 521, it is a new domain controller or RODC, and the event should be monitored.

segment.source: If the value is not 516, 521, or 515, it is not a typical value and should be monitored.
segment.target: If the value is not 516, 521, or 515, it is not a typical value and should be monitored.

segment.source: Old UAC Value is not 0x0
segment.target: Old UAC Value is not 0x0

segment.source: Typically this field is 0x0 for new computer accounts.
segment.target: Typically this field is 0x0 for new computer accounts.

segment.source: Other values might indicate an anomaly and should be monitored.
segment.target: Other values might indicate an anomaly and should be monitored.

segment.source: SID History is not -
segment.target: SID History is not -

segment.source: This field will always be set to - unless the account was migrated from another domain.
segment.target: This field will always be set to - unless the account was migrated from another domain.

segment.source: Logon Hours value other than value not set
segment.target: Logon Hours value other than value not set

segment.source: This should always be value not set for new computer accounts.
segment.target: This should always be value not set for new computer accounts.

segment.source: Consider whether to track the following account control flags:
segment.target: Consider whether to track the following account control flags:

segment.source: User account control flag to track
segment.target: User account control flag to track

segment.source: Information about the flag
segment.target: Information about the flag

segment.source: 'Encrypted Text Password Allowed' – Enabled
segment.target: 'Encrypted Text Password Allowed' – Enabled

segment.source: Should not be set for computer accounts.
segment.target: Should not be set for computer accounts.

segment.source: By default, it will not be set, and it cannot be set in the account properties in Active Directory Users and Computers.
segment.target: By default, it will not be set, and it cannot be set in the account properties in Active Directory Users and Computers.

segment.source: 'Server Trust Account' – Enabled
segment.target: 'Server Trust Account' – Enabled

segment.source: Should be enabled only for domain controllers.
segment.target: Should be enabled only for domain controllers.

segment.source: 'Don't Expire Password' – Enabled
segment.target: 'Don't Expire Password' – Enabled

segment.source: Should not be enabled for new computer accounts, because the password automatically changes every 30 days by default.
segment.target: Should not be enabled for new computer accounts, because the password automatically changes every 30 days by default.

segment.source: For computer accounts, this flag cannot be set in the account properties in Active Directory Users and Computers.
segment.target: For computer accounts, this flag cannot be set in the account properties in Active Directory Users and Computers.

segment.source: 'Smartcard Required' – Enabled
segment.target: 'Smartcard Required' – Enabled

segment.source: Should not be enabled for new computer accounts.
segment.target: Should not be enabled for new computer accounts.

segment.source: 'Trusted For Delegation' – Enabled
segment.target: 'Trusted For Delegation' – Enabled

segment.source: Should not be enabled for new member servers and workstations.
segment.target: Should not be enabled for new member servers and workstations.

segment.source: It is enabled by default for new domain controllers.
segment.target: It is enabled by default for new domain controllers.

segment.source: 'Not Delegated' – Enabled
segment.target: 'Not Delegated' – Enabled

segment.source: Should not be enabled for new computer accounts.
segment.target: Should not be enabled for new computer accounts.

segment.source: 'Use DES Key Only' – Enabled
segment.target: 'Use DES Key Only' – Enabled

segment.source: Should not be enabled for new computer accounts.
segment.target: Should not be enabled for new computer accounts.

segment.source: For computer accounts, it cannot be set in the account properties in Active Directory Users and Computers.
segment.target: For computer accounts, it cannot be set in the account properties in Active Directory Users and Computers.

segment.source: 'Don't Require Preauth' – Enabled
segment.target: 'Don't Require Preauth' – Enabled

segment.source: Should not be enabled for new computer accounts.
segment.target: Should not be enabled for new computer accounts.

segment.source: For computer accounts, it cannot be set in the account properties in Active Directory Users and Computers.
segment.target: For computer accounts, it cannot be set in the account properties in Active Directory Users and Computers.

segment.source: 'Trusted To Authenticate For Delegation' – Enabled
segment.target: 'Trusted To Authenticate For Delegation' – Enabled

segment.source: Should not be enabled for new computer accounts by default.
segment.target: Should not be enabled for new computer accounts by default.
